title: War in Ukraine: UN General Assembly calls for Russia to make reparations in invaded territory
description: The United Nations General Assembly on Monday, November 14, 2022, voted to approve a resolution recognizing that Moscow must be responsible for making reparations to Ukraine.

title: Brittany's Catholic community in shock as priest charged with rape of a minor
description: Parish priest Yannick Poligné was arrested in Paris after a 15-year-old boy called for help when he woke up, drugged and dazed, in a hotel room.

title: 2022 World Cup: Criticism of Qatar finds unequal resonance around the world
description: Although Europe has been critical of the host nation over issues such as human rights and climate change, other parts of the world do not seem to share its concerns.

title: UK to cut short deployment of troops to UN mission in Mali
description: The UK is pulling its troops out of the country earlier than planned, saying the Malian government 'is not willing to work with us to deliver lasting stability'.

title: War in Ukraine divides G20, despite Putin's absence
description: The repercussions of the conflict in terms of food security and energy markets are on the agenda at the summit, which begins on Tuesday, November 15 in Bali.

title: G20: 'Transatlantic unity must not serve to reinforce China's isolation'
description: With the G20 summit taking place in Bali on November 15 and 16, China expert Stéphanie Balme analyzes the symmetrical retreats of Washington and Beijing.

title: UK and EU target Iran officials over protest crackdown
description: Asset freezes and travel bans will be imposed on 29 officials, including interior minister Ahmad Vahidi, who the EU says is 'responsible for serious human rights violations'.

title: Even for Hong Kongers, business travel to China is still an obstacle course
description: China announced that its doors are 'wide open', but its entry conditions remain complicated, if not ludicrous, for international and domestic visitors alike.

title: Amid Europe's energy crisis, France's wood pellet industry is feeling the heat
description: In order to meet higher-than-normal demands caused by the surge in energy prices, France has been forced to import some of its wood pellets.

title: Tony Blair's former spin doctor Alastair Campbell's political podcast is a hit
description: The ex-New Labour impresario debates current affairs with former Tory MP Rory Stewart each week, winning fans with their podcast's nuanced and courteous tone.

title: 'We are facing the worst humanitarian and food crisis since World War II'
description: David Beasley, the executive director of the World Food Programme, calls on world leaders to act and coordinate. Hundreds of millions of people are threatened by famine.

title: British-Egyptian activist Alaa Abd El-Fattah says he is 'doing well' in letter
description: The sister of the British-Egyptian jailed activist Alaa Abd El-Fattah received a letter two days after her brother wrote it. In the letter, Mr. Abd El-Fattah says he is 'doing well.'

title: Biden and Xi meet in Indonesia, discussing Taiwan, cooperation and Ukraine
description: US President Joe Biden restated his support for the 'One China' policy despite 'aggressive actions', and secured meetings between lower-level officials from the two countries.

title: Russian mercenary group Wagner broadcasts execution of deserter
description: A close ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin, Yevgeny Prgozhin, said the former mercenary, who was killed by a sledgehammer blow to the head, was a traitor.

title: Galactic, the guardians of New Orleans funk, bring the party to Paris
description: The band, owners of New Orlean's famous Tipitina's club, performed a rare concert in France on Saturday, November 12, at the Musée du Quai Branly–Jacques-Chirac.

title: Kherson liberation the 'beginning of the end of the war,' says Ukrainian President Zelensky
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky visited the newly liberated city on Monday, days after Russia withdrew from Kherson.

title: New hope for those with ALS, the disease behind the Ice Bucket Challenge
description: The social media campaign raised money for research into Charcot's disease.

title: Investigation into 2021 death of 27 migrants in Channel shows rescue services ignored calls for help
description: French investigators looked into the hours leading up to the death of 27 migrants in 2021, revealing that they called for help numerous times. But French rescue services waited for them to pass into English waters, and no help was ever sent.

title: Questions remain after the collapse of two buildings in the center of Lille
description: One person was found dead in the rubble on Sunday night, while the cause of the disaster remains unknown. An investigation, under the charge of 'endangering the lives of others,' has been opened by the prosecutor.

title: Twitter removes a large part of its moderation capabilities
description: The company abruptly terminated the contracts of several thousand providers, mostly moderators.

title: France calls up Thuram and Disasi to World Cup, as Kimpembe pulls out
description: With two players in and one out, France now has a full squad of 26 players to submit to FIFA on deadline day.

title: French and Italian presidents urge return to 'cooperation' following humanitarian ship crisis
description: Emmanuel Macron and Sergio Mattarella spoke in the wake of the diplomatic crisis over the Ocean Viking.

title: Paris 2024 chooses revolutionary Phrygian cap as Olympic mascot
description: The organizer picked a French historical symbol, approved by children, to embody the Olympic and Paralymîc Games. They are named the Phrygse.

title: COP27: Maritime transport is a polluting sector that's slow to change course
description: At the conference, several countries are asking the International Maritime Organization to be more ambitious and to aim for zero carbon emissions by 2050.

title: Following Russia's retreat from Kherson, Ukraine has its sights set on Crimea
description: Russia's pullout from Kherson shows Ukraine's capacity to lead successful counteroffensives. But the Dnieper River would slow an advance on Crimea.

title: Netanyahu chooses Putin over Biden as he returns to power
description: The Kremlin can only rejoice at the return of Benjamin Netanyahu, whose antipathy toward Joe Biden is well-known and long-standing, writes columnist Jean-Pierre Filiu.

title: Ukrainian band Okean Elzy puts war center stage in Paris
description: Adored singer and charismatic politician Svyatoslav Vakarchuk played Saturday night with his pop rock band for a diaspora in search of communion.

title: France, UK sign new deal on thwarting migrant Channel crossings
description: Illegal crossings have long been a point of contention for the two countries, with London accusing Paris of not doing enough to stop the crossings.

title: How the collapse of FTX is jeopardizing cryptocurrency
description: The second largest cryptocurrency exchange platform, previously considered to be one of the safest, has collapsed in a matter of days.

title: The Giacometti Foundation will open a new museum in the heart of Paris
description: The Giacometti Institute is relocating to a 6,000-square-meter space in the former Air France terminal, with a planned opening in 2026.

title: Avian flu puts pressure on French free-range poultry farming
description: Faced with the proliferation of the virus, the French government has decided to confine all poultry throughout the country, delivering a severe blow to the sector.

title: New Delhi is becoming a pollution-induced hell
description: Extreme pollution, which will only be cleared out a bit by the monsoon season, is becoming routine for the residents of the Indian capital and the north of the country.

title: Turkey's interior minister accuses Kurdistan's Workers' Party (PKK) of bomb attack
description: An explosion tore through a busy Istanbul shopping street on Sunday, November 13, killing six and wounding dozens in what Turkey's president said bore the signs of a "terror" attack.

title: In Germany, a migration bill offers 'permitted' foreigners a solution
description: With the country suffering from a labor shortage, the German government wants to give recipients of a Duldung – a temporary suspension of deportation – better prospects for regularization.

title: Climate activists at COP27 are frustrated and uneasy
description: Protest restrictions in Egypt forced the members of global civil society, participating at the annual climate summit, to march behind closed doors.

title: Citizens of liberated Kherson celebrate: 'It's almost like normal life'
description: After eight and a half months of Russian occupation, Ukrainian forces have received an emotional welcome by the population of this southern city.

title: Zelensky accuses Russia of war crimes in Kherson
description: Since the liberation of Kherson, investigators have already documented more than 400 war crimes.
